title: They're Off
description: The new school term begins and the staff are confronted with a few changes. Mr Hedges decides to use betting as a way to educate the children on mathematics.

title: Common Law
description: Sharon is followed on the common by a dirty old man. She reports the incident to Mr Hedges putting the whole school into an uproar. The next night a number of students and the police return to where Sharon was attacked. Everyone is surprised to see the janitor Mr Potter hiding in the darkness.

title: Panalal Passes By
description: Mr Hedges organizes a boxing match for the students after the local school inspector, Mr Cromwell criticized the school for its lack of sports programs.

title: The Sporting Life
description: Mr Hedges gets the students all excited about animal conservation and it a fit of enthusiasm they decide to adopt an animal from the local zoo. Potter becomes outraged when its discovered they adopted a desert rat.

title: Norman's Conquest
description: Hedges gets the students all excited about animal conservation and it a fit of enthusiasm they decide to adopt an animal from the local zoo. Potter becomes outraged when its discovered they adopted a desert rat.

title: X Certificate
description: Everybody is rushing to be ready for the Fenn Street open day when Hedges realizes he knows nothing about the event. Apparently because of past experience the class had been allocated to look after the coats and drinks. Hedges decides he needs to change things.

title: The Decent Thing
description: Mr Hedges believes that the students need to get out and meet some of the older members of community to help them get a better understanding of their place in society.

title: The Generation Gap
description: Mr Hedges believes that the students need to get out and meet some of the older members of community to help them get a better understanding of their place in society.

title: Life Without Doris?
description: Doris is offered the opportunity to move to Australia. While she considers her options the other teachers are over the Moon at the prospect, while some begin to consider the options for her replacement.

title: The School Captain
description: The school principle Mr Cromwell decides he wants the school divided up into houses. Rather than allocate the students to a house he wants the students to find ways to make their own selection.

title: Out of the Frying Pan
description: To cover up the terrible cooking being produced by the kitchen at the school, Potter has been supplying the headmaster with imported meals. The staff and students are at breaking point and not willing to let go this time.

title: Mixed Doubles
description: The school is celebrating the headmasters birthday with varying success. A number of the students seem to be having romantic issues that Sir feels he has to intervene to help resolve.

title: Dress Circle
description: Sir fools the class into deciding to go see a production of Romeo and Juliet. On the day of the show two of the girls dress provocatively causing further scandal through-out the school.

title: The Fixer
description: Wedding bells ring out for Miss Ewell and Mr. Sibley. Meanwhile, Potter's ding-dong with his wife Ruby ends in a fly-away flourish.
